wikipedia_page.main: John Yates (17 April 1925 – 26 February 2008) was an Anglican bishop in the Church of England. He was a bishop for 22 years, serving as the Bishop of Whitby from 1972 to 1975, the Bishop of Gloucester from 1975 to 1992 and the Bishop at Lambeth from 1992 to 1994.

response: File:Gloucester Cathedral Bishop John Yates.jpg|Memorial to John Yates
* Rt Rev John Yates, Anglican clergyman. Bishop of Whitby from 1972 to 1975, then Bishop of Gloucester until 1992, and finally Bishop at Lambeth until 1994.
* John Yates (bishop) (1925–2008), former bishop of Gloucester
* John Yates (footballer, born 1929) (1929–2020), English footballer with Chester City
* John Yates (minister) (1755–1826), English Unitarian in Liverpool
* John Yates (police officer) (born 1959), former British police officer
* John Yates (rugby league), New Zealand rugby league international
* Rt. Rev. John Yates, Bishop of Gloucester from 1975 to 1991
*John Yates, 82, British Anglican prelate, Bishop of Gloucester (1975–1992).
